intro: Paronychia setacea var. longibracteata, commonly known as the long-bract sandmat, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically hairy and have a distinctive, sandpaper-like texture. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
